title: Meet and Eat
description: Time to kick off camp! Join us for some snacks and getting to know your fellow campers!

title: Creative Coding with Processing
description: This workshop will give you an introduction to the basic principles of creative coding with Processing. Processing is an open-source coding platform used by designers and developers to create interactive installations, data visualizations, software tools, and much much more.

title: iOS Boot Camp
description: Getting started with the iPhone, iPad or iPod touch using Apple’s native development tools. This is a three hour hands on workshop session that should get you beyond the “Hello World” stage and leave you with code running on you device and on to the interesting stuff. We’ll hopefully move on to playing around with the onboard sensors, or perhaps the map and location frameworks, depending on what people in the class would rather do with the time.

title: iOS Boot Camp
description: Getting started with the iPhone, iPad or iPod touch using Apple’s native development tools. This is a three hour hands on workshop session that should get you beyond the “Hello World” stage and leave you with code running on you device and on to the interesting stuff. We’ll hopefully move on to playing around with the onboard sensors, or perhaps the map and location frameworks, depending on what people in the class would rather do with the time.

title: Getting Started with Raspberry Pi
description: Learn the fundamentals of Raspberry Pi, the $35 learning computer and why people are so excited about it. This workshop will be a demo of the platform and a Raspberry Pi is not needed to participate.

title: Introduction to Soft Circuits
description: In this class, we will go over conductive materials used in creating soft circuits, such as different thread, fabrics, inks and fasteners, along with looking at microcontrollers designed specifically for wearable electronics. Projects that have been created utilizing these techniques will also be shown. We will then create a simple soft circuit with a switch and that lights up a LED. Attendees will have the chance to learn or expand on basic hand sewing techniques and experience working with new materials and skills.

title: iOS Boot Camp

We’ll hopefully move on to playing around with the onboard sensors, or perhaps the map and location frameworks, depending on what people in the class would rather do with the time.

title: C4 – Media, Interactivity & Audio for iOS
Sensing our surroundings : log sensor data using arduino
description: This hands on workshop will address visualizing data input from Arduino. The context of the class will be based around open source semi-autonomous sailing robots called Protei, designed to sense & clean oceans. After a brief introduction about Protei project, the remainder of the session will be devoted to understanding the very basics of sensing & exploring the environment through collecting & visualizing data using remote sensors, including sensors such as photocells, potentiometers, and more complex ones like barometers, GPS, and accelerometers.

title: <del>Gettin’ jiggy with the GSM shield</del>
description: The Arduino GSM shield allows you to make and receive voice calls, send and receive SMS messages, and send data over a cellular network.

title: C4 – Media, Interactivity & Audio for iOS
Intro to Python
description: This workshop will serve as an introduction to the Python programming language.  Topics covered will include:

title: C4 – Media, Interactivity & Audio for iOS
Arduino Programming Basics
description: So if you want to move beyond the blinking LED and learn some more coding for the Arduino, this is the class for you. We’ll review some of the coding from Arduino 101 and then move onto variables, for loops, while loops, and writing your own functions.

title: UX Skill – Responsive Design Process
description: Do you create UX documents in Omnigraffle, Visio, InDesign, Axure or Illustrator?  Does the design team still create Photoshop PSD files to hand off to the developer?  That no longer works in the responsive design world we live in.

title: Flying Robots
description: There is a growing community interested in building flying autonomous robots.   We will go over the history of flying robots.  The current and future roles these robots will play in our society.
comment: I’m going to try to make this one!

title: Zero to Plastic Part 2: 3D Scanning with ReconstructMe
description: We’ll explore 3D scanning using an Xbox Kinect controller with ReconstructMe software, and the steps needed to convert these scans to 3D printable models.

title: Revisiting the GSM shield
description: This is a make-up session from the other week.
comment: Aw man, can’t do weekends. Let me know if you’d consider either another session or a 1-on-1. This was the class I was looking forward to the most this summer!
